problem_text: In Fig. 21-32, particles 1 and 2 of charge $q_1=q_2=+3.20 \times 10^{-19} \mathrm{C}$ are on a $y$ axis at distance $d=17.0 \mathrm{~cm}$ from the origin. Particle 3 of charge $q_3=+6.40 \times 10^{-19} \mathrm{C}$ is moved gradually along the $x$ axis from $x=0$ to $x=$ $+5.0 \mathrm{~m}$. At what values of $x$ will the magnitude of the electrostatic force on the third particle from the other two particles be minimum?
